005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.IMarkupString;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupDataTypeProvider;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupLine;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupMultiline;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015
016public interface IMarkupItem extends IUntypedAtomicItem {
017  /**
018   * Construct a new item using the provided {@code value}.
019   *
020   * @param value
021   *          a line of markup
022   * @return the new item
023   */
024  @NonNull
025  static IMarkupItem valueOf(@NonNull MarkupLine value) {
026    return new MarkupLineItemImpl(value);
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Construct a new item using the provided {@code value}.
031   *
032   * @param value
033   *          multiple lines of markup
034   * @return the new item
035   */
036  @NonNull
037  static IMarkupItem valueOf(@NonNull MarkupMultiline value) {
038    return new MarkupMultiLineItemImpl(value);
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Cast the provided type to this item type.
043   *
044   * @param item
045   *          the item to cast
046   * @return the original item if it is already this type, otherwise a new item
047   *         cast to this type
048   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
049   *           if the provided {@code item} cannot be cast to this type
050   */
051  @NonNull
052  static IMarkupItem cast(@NonNull IAnyAtomicItem item) {
053    return MarkupDataTypeProvider.MARKUP_MULTILINE.cast(item);
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Get the "wrapped" markup value.
058   *
059   * @return the underlying markup value
060   */
061  @NonNull
062  IMarkupString<?> asMarkup();
063
064  @Override
065  default IMarkupItem castAsType(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
066    return cast(item);
067  }
068
069  @Override
070  default int compareTo(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
071    return compareTo(cast(item));
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Compares this value with the argument.
076   *
077   * @param item
078   *          the item to compare with this value
079   * @return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this value is less
080   *         than, equal to, or greater than the {@code item}.
081   */
082  default int compareTo(@NonNull IMarkupItem item) {
083    return asString().compareTo(item.asString());
084  }
085}
